original: (a)      "Contract Period" shall mean that period of time commencing on January 1, 2000 and concluding December 31, 2003, unless terminated sooner as provided herein.
ollama_generated:
"(a)   'Contract Term' denotes the continuous duration, starting from January 1, 2000, that shall persist until such time a mutually agreed termination occurs or any earlier termination as stipulated within this agreement takes effect."

In this revised version, the clause maintains professionalism while slightly altering the original's meaning. Instead of clearly defining an end date for the contract period (December 31, 2003), it now implies a continuous duration that may be terminated under specific conditions or at any agreed-upon time by both parties.

modified: (e)  "Contract Territory" shall be limited to the geographical region agreed upon between the Parties. In the event that a Party seeks to expand the scope of this agreement, prior written consent from both Parties shall be obtained before any such expansion occurs.

original: (f)      "Outerwear" shall mean the golf shirts, sweaters, windshirts and raingear worn by Duval when he plays professional golf.
ollama_generated: (f)  "Outerwear" is hereby defined as the golf attire, including but not limited to golf shirts, sweaters, windshirts, and raingear, which may be donned by Duval during his professional golf performances, subject to any regulations or requirements set forth by the relevant golfing authorities. It does not include any personal items or accessories. The responsibility of ensuring the maintenance and replacement of these items shall lie with Duval unless otherwise agreed in writing.

original: 2. GRANT OF RIGHTS. In consideration of the remuneration to be paid to Licensor pursuant hereto, Licensor grants to Company the right and license during the Contract Period to use the Duval Identification solely in connection with the advertisement and promotion of Company's Products within the Contract Territory as set forth herein. Licensor agrees not to grant the right to use the Duval Identification to anyone other than Company in connection with the advertisement and promotion of Products. It is understood that Company may not use the Duval Identification in connection with any items for sale or resale, other than Company Products as specified herein.
ollama_generated: 2. GRANT OF LICENSING RIGHTS. In exchange for the remuneration to be received by the Licensee under this Agreement, the Licensee hereby grants to the Client a non-exclusive license during the Term of this Agreement, to utilize the Duval Mark solely for the purpose of advertising and promoting the Client's Goods within the defined Territory as outlined herein. The Licensee undertakes not to grant any other party the right to use the Duval Mark in connection with the advertisement and promotion of goods, except for the Client in relation to the goods specified herein. It is understood that the Client shall not be authorized to use the Duval Mark in association with any items for sale or resale, other than the Client's Goods as detailed within this Agreement. Furthermore, it should be noted that the Licensee bears no responsibility for any unauthorized uses of the Duval Mark by third parties outside of the scope of this Agreement.

original: (b) As additional remuneration hereunder, Company agrees to pay Licensor an Additional License Fee of One Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($1,500,000) to be paid in quarterly installments on or before January 1, April 1, July 1 and October 1 of the first Contract Year.
modified: (b) As further compensation for this agreement, Licensor shall receive an Additional License Fee of One Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($1,500,000), payable in four installments. The first payment is due on the effective date of the contract, with subsequent payments due on April 1, July 1, and October 1 of the initial contract year, and the final payment due on January 1 of the following year. In essence, Licensor will receive the complete Additional License Fee spread over a period of five quarters instead of four.

original: Accomplishment                    Additional Remuneration --------------                    ----------------------- PGA Tour Win                                                               $25,000 PGA Tour 2-5 place finish                                                  $10,000 World Championship Event Win                                               $40,000 World Championship Event 2-5 place finish                                  $15,000 Major Win (Masters, U.S. Open, British Open, PGA Championship)            $100,000 Major 2-5 place finish                                                     $25,000 Named to Ryder Cup or President's Cup Team                                 $15,000 Player of the Year                                                         $40,000 All additional remuneration will be due within thirty (30) days of each such accomplishment. Company agrees that all additional remuneration earned by Licensor during each Contract Year will be added to the Annual Fee for each remaining Contract Year during the Contract Period.
ollama_generated:
Achievement                            Extra Compensation ----------------- -------------------------
   Win at PGA Tour Event                                               $25,000
   Finish 2nd to 5th at PGA Tour Event                               $10,000
   Victory at World Championship Event                             $40,000
   2nd to 5th finish at World Championship Event               $15,000
   Winning a Major (Masters, U.S. Open, British Open, PGA Championship)     $100,000
   Finishing 2nd to 5th in a Major                                        $25,000
   Selection for Ryder Cup or President's Cup Team               $15,000 (Note: This compensation is payable only once during the Contract Period)
   Being recognized as Player of the Year                          $40,000 (Note: This compensation is subject to the Licensor meeting all other contractual obligations and standards for Player of the Year)

All additional compensation will be paid within thirty (30) days of the Company's receipt of official confirmation of each such achievement. The Licensor acknowledges that any additional compensation earned during each Contract Year may be deferred and applied as a reduction in the Annual Fee for subsequent Contract Years, at the discretion of the Company.

original: (b) Should Company use Duval in television advertising to promote Company's Products, Company will make all applicable required union scale and pension and welfare payments. Company and Licensor will mutually agree on the portion of the Annual Fee that shall be allocated for such broadcast services.
ollama_generated: (b) In the event that Duval is utilized by Company in television advertisements to boost Company's Product line, it shall be the responsibility of Company to make all necessary union scale, pension, and welfare payments. However, any determination regarding the allocation of the Annual Fee for these broadcast services will be a matter of mutual agreement between Company and Licensor. In this scenario, it is understood that the portion allocated for such services does not exceed the agreed-upon Annual Fee amount unless otherwise specified in writing by both parties.

original: (c) Licensor agrees to cause Duval to wear Company's Products sold by Company when playing professional golf, and while participating in golf exhibitions and outings, upon the condition that Company supply Duval with such amounts of properly fitting Products, in fabrics and styles approved by Duval and Company, as Duval may reasonably request which are suitable for his use in tournament competition. Company agrees to pay all charges in connection with the delivery of such Products to Duval, including shipping charges, air freight charges and customs charges. Company agrees to reimburse Licensor's authorized agent for all such expenses incurred by it in connection with the transfer of such Products to Duval.
ollama_generated: (c) Licensor undertakes that Duval will preferably, but not obligatorily, opt to wear Company's Products when engaging in professional golf, golf exhibitions, and outings, subject to the provision that the Company will strive to provide Duval with appropriate quantities of Products in fabrics and styles acceptable to both parties. Duval retains the right to request reasonable quantities of such Products for tournament competition. It is understood that the Company may not always be able to meet these requests due to production, availability, or other constraints. The Company will bear all costs associated with the delivery of such Products to Duval, including shipping, air freight, and customs charges. Furthermore, the Company agrees to reimburse Licensor's authorized agent for any expenses incurred during the transfer of these Products to Duval, provided that such expenses are within the scope of the agreed-upon arrangements.

original: (b) Company shall provide and maintain, at its own expense, commercial general liability insurance and advertising injury coverage, with limits of not less than One Million Dollars ($1,000,000.00), and shall cause such policy to be endorsed to state that Duval is an additional named insured thereunder. A certificate of insurance evidencing such coverage shall be furnished to Duval within thirty (30) days of the full execution of this Agreement. Such insurance policy shall provide that the insurer shall not terminate or materially modify such policy or remove Duval as an additional named insured without prior written notice to Duval at least twenty (20) days in advance thereof.
ollama_generated: (b) Duval is granted the right, at its own expense, to secure and manage, a commercial general liability insurance and advertising injury coverage with minimum limits of One Million Dollars ($1,000,000.00). If Duval chooses not to obtain this insurance, Company will be responsible for procuring the necessary coverage and shall cause such policy to be endorsed to include Company as an additional named insured thereunder. A certificate of insurance evidencing such coverage must be provided to Company within thirty (30) days of the full execution of this Agreement. The insurance policy shall contain a clause prohibiting the insurer from unilaterally terminating or materially modifying the policy without providing at least twenty (20) days' written notice to Company prior to such action.

original: 11. DEFAULT. (a) If either party at any time during the Contract Period shall (i) fail to make any payment of any sum of money herein specified to be made, or (ii) fail to observe or&bbsp;perform any of the covenants, agreements or obligations hereunder (other than the payment of money), the nondefaulting party may terminate this Agreement as follows: as to (i) if such payment is not made within ten (10) days after the defaulting party shall have received written notice of such failure to make payment, or as to (ii) if such default is not cured within thirty (30) days after the defaulting party shall have received written notice specifying in reasonable detail the nature of such default. In order to be a sufficient notice hereunder, any such written notice shall specify in detail each item of default and shall specify the provision of this Agreement which applies to each item of default, and shall specify in detail the action the defaulting party is required to take in order to cure each item of default.
ollama_generated:
11. BREACH AND TERMINATION: (a) In the event that either party breaches any provision of this Agreement during the Contract Term, including but not limited to failure to make payments or fulfill any other obligations as specified herein, the non-breaching party retains the right to elect whether to remedy the breach or terminate this Agreement. Such termination shall occur:

   (i) If the initial breach is a payment default, and if the defaulting party does not rectify the default within fifteen (15) days from receipt of a written notice detailing the non-payment, or

   (ii) If the default is not related to payment, the defaulting party shall have sixty (60) days from receipt of a written notice detailing the breach, specifying in reasonable detail the nature of the breach and the provision(s) of this Agreement applicable to such breach, to remedy the breach. If the defaulting party fails to cure the breach within the specified timeframe, the non-breaching party may elect to terminate this Agreement.

In order for a notice to be considered sufficient under these terms, it must include explicit details of each breach, specify the provisions of this Agreement that have been violated, and outline in detail the actions required by the defaulting party to rectify each breach.

original: 18. WAIVER. The failure of either party at any time or times to demand strict performance by the other of any of the terms, covenants or conditions set forth herein shall not be construed as a continuing waiver or relinquishment thereof and each may at any time demand strict and complete performance by the other of said terms, covenants and conditions. Any waiver of such rights must be set forth in writing.
ollama_generated: 18. WAIVER AND CONTINUING OBLIGATIONS. While either party may forgo enforcing strict adherence to any specific term, covenant, or condition outlined within this agreement at any given instance, such forbearance should not be construed as a blanket waiver of future enforcement rights. Both parties remain bound by their ongoing commitment to uphold these terms, covenants, and conditions, and either party retains the prerogative to demand strict compliance at any subsequent point in time. Any relaxation or concession of rights must be expressly documented in writing to maintain its validity.

original: 19. SEVERABILITY. If any provision of this Agreement shall be declared illegal, invalid, void or unenforceable by any judicial or administrative authority, the validity of any other provision and of the entire Agreement shall not be affected thereby.
ollama_generated: 19. DISJOINTED PROVISIONS. In the event that any provision of this Agreement is deemed unlawful, invalid, voidable, or non-binding by a judicial or administrative body, such declaration shall not nullify the remaining provisions or the entire Agreement's integrity and enforceability. Instead, the remaining provisions shall continue to be binding and enforceable without regard to the affected provision.
